intro: Phymatopsis taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan phymatopsis, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or mountainous regions. Its small white or yellowish flowers are usually short-lived but attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
